page.title: 17RAILWAY CELEBRATIONS SWANAGE
page.content: 11.00am - 12.30pm - Re-Enactment of the opening at Swanage station. Costume competition follows. It was raining on the Monday so the carriages were not used. The other events went as planned and some of the children from our school dressed in Edwardian costume, but they didn't win a prize. There were rides on the train and a postman stamped First Day Covers to celebrate the centenary. Reproductions of the "Poole and Bournemouth Herald" newspaper of 21st May 1885 were being sold. In it was an article about the opening of the Swanage - Wareham line. It described how, when the first train approached Swanage, crowds of people began cheering and waving their hats.
